description.value: Maps Category codes as found in the Contraindications and intolerances (Dutch: Contra-indicaties en overgevoeligheden, abbreviated as CiO) information standard to <http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/allergy-intolerance-category> as found in `AllergyIntolerance.category` in FHIR R4. This ConceptMap is based on the discussion in <https://bits.nictiz.nl/browse/TER-15>.

display.value: Propensity to adverse reactions to food
Propensity to adverse reaction to contact allergen

comment.value: In general allergens within this category belong to the FHIR category 'environment', as these allergens are mostly used to indicate that someone had an allergic reaction to that substance. However, if such an allergen would be used during e.g. a skin or provocation test, it is prepared and used as a diagnostic agent, hence it could be categorized by the FHIR category 'biologic'. Thus it is advised to map this category on 'environment' by default, unless it is known that the category 'biologic' applies.

The required AllergyIntolerance.category binding does not recognize the use case wherein the category is 'other'. If the actual value associated with OTH is not known, omit AllergyIntolerance.category. If the actual value associated with OTH is known and relevant, use AllergyIntolerance.category (without value) in combination with extension http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/ext-CodeSpecification with the description under valueCodeableConcept.text.
